trial_identification.studytitle: The Feasibility and Efficacy of an Individualised Approach to increase Physical Activity among Women with Previous Gestational Diabetes Mellitus
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised controlled open clinical trial of the Feasibility and Efficacy of an Individualised Approach to increase Physical Activity among Women with Previous Gestational Diabetes Mellitus

interventions.interventions: Supported intervention (initial face to face assessment and counselling followed by weekly telephone support for a period of three months) to promote physical activity
interventions.comparator: Routine post natal care with some written information promoting physical activity

primaryOutcome.outcome: Change in physical activity, measured using Australian Women's Activity Scale (AWAS)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Starting 6 weeks post partum. Final assessment 4.5 months post partum

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Insulin resistance using homeostasis model assessment (HOMA)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Starting 6 weeks post partum. Final assessment 4.5 months post partum

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Adult females Recent pregnancy complicated by gestational diabetes
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes at 6 weeks post partum Unable to communicate in English Planning further pregnancy within 12 months

trial_design.concealment: Random number table used by investigator not involved in study treatment.
trial_design.sequence: Random number table Stratification by baseline physical activity and delivery type. (Cesarean section or traumatic vaginal delivery vs Normal delivery)

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: Mater Clinical School Mater Health Services Raymond Tce South Brisbane QLD 4101
